sentence.Network_en: I rode a hydrofoil ferry across the bay this morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天早上我驾驶快艇驶过海湾.

sentence.Network_en: Why can a hydrofoil move on a layer of air?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么气垫船能靠后方的气流移动?
那艘水翼船不久就增加速度.

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1920s: from hydro- 'relating to water', on the pattern of aerofoil

entry.def: A hydrofoil is a boat which can travel partly out of the water on a pair of flat parts like wings. You can also refer to the flat parts as hydrofoils .

means.word_mean: 1. a device consisting of a flat or curved piece (as a metal plate) so that its surface reacts to the water it is passing through;

sentences.sentence: "the fins of a fish act as hydrofoils"

means.word_mean: 2. a speedboat that is equipped with hydrofoils that lift it so that it skims the water at high speeds;

sentences.sentence: "the museum houses a replica of the jet hydroplane that broke the record"

auth_sentence.content: In May, a Hong Kong-Macau hydrofoil slammed into a speedboat, killing the small boat's operator.
